number of helpful: 7 of 17 people (41%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 11, 2014
												Dear god why didn't anybody warn me about this game? The story is promising and the humor up my street, but it's unplayable! Abysmal graphics for a 2011 release only surpassed by dreadful performance and topped of with horrible camera movement. In a bit more detail the graphics themselves look like the game's ported from playstation 2 (two), the performance feels like they ported it without ever playtesting it. It runs smoothly, then suddenly stutters, then runs again. Even cutscenes are affected. Mostly arrives after you get the ui presentation for new weapons or moves. Lastly there's the issue with controls. In the 'tutorial' you get told to press T to enter 1st person mode (even if you've already done so by the way), but every time you look at something and press c it'll take you to 3rd person mode again. Later when you aim the pepperspray using T (gone is the first person mode now) intuitively (sarcasm) you'll have to rightclick to use it and left click to exit aim mode. The list goes on. Basically it is a potentially good story built into a horrible gaming platform. You'd be better off finding a video with the cutscenes on youtube than actually enduring the gameplay yourself. I know the game was only €5 but it's not even worth that. Makes me sick to think that I gave EA money for another piece of beep.

number of helpful: 10 of 23 people (43%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 22, 2013
												Madness Returns tries to do something interesting. And there are hints of effort everywere. The game shines in the visual design of the horrobly bleak london and the fantastically bleak wonderland. But everything else is just a mess.The gameplay is very remicent of the early 2000's, which basically means "jump puzzles". A lot of jump puzzles. Most of the gameplay is navigating levels that become emptier and longer the farther you advance in the game. And the scenery quickly stops being inspiering and intruging, becoming repetetive and numbing.There's also combat. And it too is antiquated. Auto-lock is cumbersome and unresponsive, the camera struggles to keep both you and the target on the screen. It really feels like something made early into the 3D era. Other then that, the combat works. It's very traditional, no surprises and when you are not fighting the camera it can be even fun.The level design is really where it all falls apart. Levels are so long they are tedius, and the game struggles to creat clear story objectives. Until the final level just gives up and your only motivation is reaching the next chek point.The game as a whole feels unfinished. The controls feel loose and invisible walls become more and more prominant. The ending level sends you to wander through a long empty corridor that feels like an unfinshed level. Other wierd instances include a boss that defeats itself as soon as it appears and alice changing her outfit when growing into a giant.The story suffers from being a sequel. Basically it has to use the same tragedy the previous game used. It tries to throw some intrigue into the mix. But it does it all with too broad a brush. Everyone around Alice are corrupt, abusers or down-right evil. It makes the world feel like a characature rather then wonderland fufiling that role. Beacuse the game is so long, you figure out the plot hours befor the twist is revealed in full. And you have to spend the last few hours humuring the story as it tries to build suspence and surprise.In short. It's a game that needed to be trimmed or filled.

content:
Posted: March 18
												Editting this because I just remembered that this game has some bugs with the controls and you may have to edit the config files to get it to work, also if you are using mouse and keyboard you may notice some minigames won't work if you also have a controller plugged in at the same time. This is a 3rd person action gamewith some easy puzzle elements. Most of the gameplay is fighting and jumping around. I thought the story was pretty good for this type of game, but most of the puzzles were very simple i.e. put a timed weight one switch and then traverse to a platform that just appeared. There are a lot of mini games that make the game play more diverse, but my biggest gripe is the game is too long and once you learn the game play and upgrade Alice's health and weapons it get's boring pretty fast. If you're like me you'll be wishing it was over by chapter 3 or 4. The levels themselves don't offer much variety, just seems like they were retextured for each chapter. You'll encounter the same things in each chapter, floating platforms, invisible platforms that appear when you shrink, boxes you can smash for health/currency, a bunch of things to collect.  Compared to games like Banjo Kazooie or even Mario 64 it's a let down. At least in those games each world felt unique with it's own challenges and distinct level design..

number of helpful: 1 of 5 people (20%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 29, 2014
												I wanted to play and like this game.  Played it halfway, and it's not so good.  The game is way too long,  I dumped in about 8 hours and I'm still not finished; that's a bad thing considering what the game actually is.  A literal platformer that has you jumping across some big and some not so big gaps.  You can find hidden "memories", but they just make the game take longer.  Every 10th-20th platform has a few bad guys that are going to be the same from a pool of about 5 different ones that are unique to that chapter and fighting them just makes you feel like you're being slowed down, because fighting them doesn't give you anything, the upgrades in the game come from collected teeth (coins). The visual style is almost enough to make it worth it, the different chapters do look very cool, the game is polished and runs smoothly, but it has a fatal flaw: I'm playing this game with a controller and there is no camera movement that reorients the camera as you move.  Every time you want to look a different direction, you have to move the camera yourself with the R-Stick (Xbox 360 Controller).  This can be very problematic when you have a series of 5-10 platforms that you need to land on serially without stopping; if you don't plan the angle of the camera around the jumps you'll make, you'll die (3 falls and you have to go back to a checkpoint, which can be 10 minutes worth of play).  Most 3d games since Super Mario 64 have some sort of camera assist in this fashion, but not this one.I really wanted to like this game, but there are just a few too many problems and I have too many games where I know these things aren't an issue that I have lined up to play.  Maybe I'll finish it another time after having read one of the guides online on how to fix the camera, but not now.

content:
Posted: April 13, 2014
												Stunning. Absolutely stunning. It's been a long, long time since I've played a game that left me baffled at the level design this much. Every new area I entered, I always had to look around a bit first, literally making me go 'ohh' and 'aah' at most occasions. This whole game is just so incredibly lovingly crafted. There's so much detail to everything. I can't even wrap my mind around it. The game play it self is nothing special, but it works just fine. Target lock is a bit shoddy at times, but you'll manage. The dialogue might be a tad bit pretentious, but that actually fits the game's style. But really, this game is a bloody gem. A floating island of gold in a sea of mediocre crap. I've never played a game like this.

number of helpful: 4 of 12 people (33%) found this review helpful2 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 23, 2015
												I wanted to like this game, I really did. But I just can't. I'm a platform, adventure game, controller friendly gal but this...THIS...is nothing more than an excercise in pure fustration. It ceases to be enjoyable about a half an hour in. Once you complete Chapter 1, it's all down hill from there (I've decided to quit part way through Chapter 5). Yes it's a pretty game. Yes it is a dark, interesting twist on Alice in Wonderland but any positives are outweighed by the sheer agony you will experience trying to play this. It's not even challenging just repetitive, annoying, and unnecessarily difficult. The only reason I've sunk so many hours into this game is because I'm stubborn and really enjoy Alice themed things, usually. I was also curious to finish the story but guess what? That's what YouTube is for. Hopefully one day some developer will make a decent dark Alice game. I strongly urge you to wait until that time. The only way I would reccomend this game to anyone is if they were my enemy and I wanted to hit them with an extreme dissapointment/money wasting combo shot.

number of helpful: 3 of 10 people (30%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 2, 2014
												An intriguing concept and beautiful art design are unfortunately marred by this game's unimaginative game play, repetitive levels, sub-par voice acting/scripting and pointless collectibles. The story could have been interesting if it were better expanded upon by fleshed-out side characters or just better written dialogue. The weapons all pretty much work the same way, and the controls  (in combat especially) are wonky and frustrating. If taken to the level of the Bioshock series, this could have been a dark, bloody, beautifully atmospheric take on Alice in Wonderland. And seeing what Bioshock was able to do, even with some of its samey weapon choices in the first installment, the story was scary and deeply engaging. It would be best to simply buy the art book for this series rather than waste time on the game itself. You'll get all the pretty, without the inanity, repetition and occasionally horrible psuedo-British accents.

content:
Posted: June 27, 2016
												I was eager to play this game. A few friends of mine told me that i would enjoy it. Well maybe on console.Before i even start, i'll give you an advice. Dont play this game without a controller. the aiming system is so bad it manage to give me cancer despite i dont smoke. And since switching ennemies is a pain in the♥♥♥♥♥while dodging things thrown at you with a keyboard, sometimes u might lose your cool :)So let's get started. I really loved the story, the sound effects/voices/musics were all perfectly on point, the environnements were really well inspired, i guess that's why at first i was "whoaw, what a great game, i'm going to enjoy it".Then it started. "What's started?" asked the audience. "I started to feel the something was odd, sth was foul in this world. I could feel the pain getting in my fingers. What's this? ♥♥♥♥♥♥ controls and inputs not taken in count? Multipled bugs? aw♥♥♥♥♥♥feelsbad man".Furthermore, the gameplay is lazy as ♥♥♥♥. As if beeing pretty bad wasnt enough, there is also no combo, no aerial attacks... nothing. Empty. Sometimes when u jump and dodge, ur dash goes the wrong way :)I'll finish with the graphics. It's ugly. Very ugly. Released in 2011, the game's ugly and the optimisation is bad as hell. I couldnt run physx with a high end computer bought in 2014. 60 fps when there's nothing on the screen, 30 fps when i start killing mobs and spit goo on the floor.As a story telling game, it's great. As a game you're supposed to play, it's bad.I cant recommend it. I would have if the game had lasted for 8 hours. Yet, i had to endure the ♥♥♥♥♥♥ controls for something like 12 hours, and it really ruined my experience. I can understand why people are so fond of this game, but i just cant let the poor gameplay slip. It's a video game, not a movie.

number of helpful: 9 of 23 people (39%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 9, 2014
												Things that were once acceptable and the norm in game design now completely ruin games for me. Take the Alice game. Awegame. Dark, twisted, adult Alice in Wonderland 3D action platformer. However, once I made it to the Eyepot place the flaws revealed themselves. You fight what appears to be a boss type teapot creature. Beat him and you move onto another teapot with an extra bad guy. Beat that and you move onto two teapots and more extra bad guys. Die on any one of these parts and do the entire thing over again. Really. Lazy game development. I hate when devs take the short cut of just adding more of the same tough enemies instead of presenting the player with new looks and new mobs. And having a player start over from the begining of the routine every time they die seems like such an unneccessary aggrovation in this day and age. And this is just one primary example of this type of design in the game.I would love to have an open world Alice in Wonderland game with exploration. This story and world calls for it. I knew this wasn't it before I bought it but it is extremely linear. You can not even access the entire linear area with so many invisible walls.I do not have the patience with this type of thing like I did when I was 9. My free time is valuable and I'm not going to waste fighting more and more teapots only to be kicked back to the start for one slip up. I wanted to like this game. It has a lot of good qualities but ultimately this is what ruined it for me.

content:
Posted: October 26, 2014
												If you are thinking of buying this game. read at your own risk. there are spoilers ahead.and before you read and think "huh you are stupid, the game is totaly different from the movies and books. me caveman" note that I am aware that this game is a lot more "vulgar", "horror related" and "gory" than the rest of the series.this game... oh this game. I can write so much about his game.Let's start with what bothered me the most in the beginning: the Voice actress for the main character Alice. the voice in the game was so boring and so unpassionate that it would almost seem like she was narrating the whole time while she was talking. seriously! There is less enthousiasm in her voice then there is in the voice of a narrator of a Wildlife Documentary on Animal Planet.I am a big fan of Alice in wonderland, but never have I seen such a poor portrayal of the characters of this tale.The Mad Hatter for example:The mad hatter is some kind of "Robotic Goblin like creature" with his own personal army of "tea cup wearing Goblins" and machines shaped like tea pots. and they al live in this giant "Steampunk like factory city" (which is beautifull from the outside) the mad hatter also lives here with the Bunny and the Hare which are just a bunny and a hare... but the Hare has robotic steampunk like limbs. oh and they are now the enemy of the Mad Hatter for some reason.that is just an example of one of the awfully portrayed characters.now for something else.. Boss Battles... oh but what is there to talk about? THERE ARE NONE!never in my life have I seen so much awesome ways to make Boss Battles... but the developers are just like "Meh, cutscenes will do just fine here instead".example:you arrive to the railroad where you find some kind of weird train that is bound to destroy Wonderland (i'll get back on that later here) and you are together with the Mad Hatter. you came here fighting nothing but "weird black baby faced blob things", "tea cup goblins", "hot tea spitting tea pot machine things" and "Giant weird black baby faced blob things"when a cutscene starts and I immediately thought "Awh Yiss! boss fight!".and then this Giant machine comes up . bigger than what could fit on my screen! i was so exicted at this point... and then what happens you ask? it kills itself..... it just destroys itself..... and then the loading screens starts. Cutscene with weird paper doll things portray what happens. Hatter dies..... and end of chapter.. i just rage quitted at this moment. i continued playing later on but I was so angry at this.the plot is sooooo weird. i must say that portraying Alice as a psychopath crossed my mind once in a while after the movies and such. but that is not the biggest part of the story the game is about this big "train" that was made by the immagination of alice and put inside wonderland. this train just goes around wrecking everyone's♥♥♥♥♥♥and then goes on. there are also things in the game that point to some sort of trauma that Alice has. because she was the only one that survived a fire in her home as a child and she wants to know who did it.the cutscenes... don't get me started about those ♥♥♥♥ers. there are kinda good cutscenes in this game. but then you have the cutscenes at the end of every chapter. here you have cutscenes that have paper dolls flay their arms around and where they are bobbing up and down to indicate who is talking. it was just a let down in my eyes.the gameplay mechanics are mediocre. i don't like platformers a lot, but this was really easy especially with the special "Pre-Order dresses" that are unlockable by just editing the INI file a little. you have one dress here that gives you the ability to go into some kind of "extra Bloody Period Sayian mode" every time you want to. and this makes you invincible. so it's just like activating the God Mode in every other game. this game just tries to be subtle with it's cheating mechanic.the auto save feature just pops up every 12 hours of gameplay or so. if you die at 11:59 playing time they just set you back all that time... JK. but seriously there is no safe feature and the autosave pops op like 4 times every chapter. so when you die you are basically screwed.the monsters are really weird. here are the monsters i have met in my game before I quit the game for goodBlack worm thingFlying screwsBlack baby faced blob thingFlying black baby faced blob thingBigger black baby faced blob thingEven bigger black baby faced blob thing with wheels and flamethrowerTea pot machine that fire hot teaTea cup goblin with spearIce fishBomb throwing ghostCrab with cannons instead of clawsSamurai insectsSamurai insects with bowsBigger samurai insectBlackjack card with spearArmored blackjack card with spearGiant guy with huge axe that is awesome who is killed with a cutsceneDollFlying Dollthat were all the monsters... and what the actual ♥♥♥♥. no wonder Alice is in a mental institution.but there is one thing that makes this game a little bit better. just the one thing that makes it all worth it.. the thing that makes the game so that i will not give it a 1/10 but maybe a 3/10... that is the scenery. the scenery is just plain beautifull some times.so if you play games for just the scenery and views buy this. if you play games for any other reason then don't buy this.i said maybe... my final verdict is 2/101 point for scenery and 1 point for the "quit game" button

number of helpful: 3 of 11 people (27%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: June 23, 2016
												I had high hopes for this game. I'm a huge fan of Alice in Wonderland, from the original stories to the multiple disney representaions. This game's early Tim Burton-esque art style is beautiful, and the story twists itself into one of surreal horror that caught my attention. But the art style and the story is where this game ends. The platforming is basic jump-here jump-there stuff that takes up way too much time, the combat is incredibly basic besides the fact that you can dodge (the dodging can be satisfying I will admit), and there are small collectibles strewn all over the map for you to collect, a concept that hasn't been cool since the old Playstation 2 days where it seemed like anyone who had collectibles in their game could be published. And that's what this game is in terms of gameplay, it's like an old boring PS2 platformer without the nostalgia. And what I absolutely hate in any game is fetch quests, the kind of quests where you walk into a large room, a character tells you to go grab somethings, and you have to go through multiple dungeons and grab multiple items in said dungeons and bring them all back in order to finally make progress. (I'm talking to you Darksiders 2). As soon as I met the Mad Hatter and his goblin-ugly @$$ told me to fetch his limbs, I exited the game and refunded it. If the developers had used their talents to make an animated movie of some sort, I may have really enjoyed this experience, but as a game it's not worth the time it takes to find four limbs.TL;DR: Great Artstyle and interesting twist on the old story. But the amusement dies after experiencing incredibly boring gameplay mixed with old old platforming tropes, clunky combat, and uninspired-at-best missions. Cannot recommend.

												On the plus side, it isn't unplayably bad like the first game, but on the other hand it isn't any fun either. It's just astoundingly mediocre, at least up to the point I played. It also doesn't look anywhere near as good now as the first game did when it was new (which was enough to get me to finish it using cheats), and the idea behind it isn't novel anymore, at least in a game. Some things in it do look rather nice, but then there's random crap that's brown and murky and some disappointing low-res textures that ruin the one redeeming aspect of the game. Mostly it's too much linear jumping and bland combat.

number of helpful: 0 of 5 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 7, 2016
												The game looks great the story is fun and interesting and I really enjoyed it at first.  That being said the combat system is horible. They force you to us the FOCUS system to lock on and to block attacks witch would be fine but the camara does not stay behind you it goes all overthe place.  When you dodge you end up not going where you want to even thou you are holding the dierction the crazy camara angle is showing you should move.  It also zooms you in to the taget you are locked onto, but when you are fighting 6+ monsters at the same time you can't tell when you are going to be attack by the others.  I am playing the game on nightmare and when you get hit 1 time it takes half your life 2 times and you die.  There is no room for error but the combat system is so broken there is no way to avoid getting hit when you are constantly not dodging the direction you want to.Lastly the autosave does not happen enough, when you die (and I did alot) you will find yourself redoing large parts of the game just to get back to the place you died.  If the game would autosave before major battles instead of making you replay 15 minutes of parcore and then have to survie the bad combat system it would make it bareble.  In a couple of instances the game saved before you had to load a new zone, so when you died you would have to reload the new zone again, it made no sense. I reaqlly like the game I just can't stand the bad camara work if they locked the camara behind you it would make everthing better. but as it is right now when you are locked on and circleing an enemy the camara view does what it wants.  I am sure if you play the game on normal it wont matter that you can't time your dodges perfect and go where you want to.  I wanted to play the game at it hardest difficulty and when poor combat mechanics are kiling me it takes all of the fun out of the game.

content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												1: combat is boring, predictable.....a bad rip-off of Ocarina of Time.  You have only one defensive maneuver, which looks the same no matter how you do it.  Enemies take advantage of you not having camera control when you "Z target" and gang up.2: The atmosphere is gloomy, dark, moody.  It builds and builds and builds up the sense that somewhere, sometime, you'll be fighting something that requires more than just hacking away with your primary weapons....Well, that never happens.  You simply pick up another item/ability and have to spam that to win, instead of being allowed to use other abilities and fight as you want.3: the game stutters, has pop-in, and not all the controls map to a 360 controller...I'm actually stuck in this game and will never finish it because EA is too ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ lazy to either map one of the items to the controller layout, or allow me to use the keyboard/mouse and controller together.  And because this is a♥♥♥♥♥♥tier port from a console game, I cannot re-map my controls on my controller to suit what problems I may encounter down the road.I literally cannot do ANY ♥♥♥♥ING DAMAGE to a tutorial fight enemy and therefore I cannot proceed.  I haven't beaten the FIRST ♥♥♥♥ING BOSS and I have to give up.Don't buy this piece of♥♥♥♥♥♥  Don't even look at it.  Don't even pirate it...unless the pirated version allows you to

												If you havn't played "American McGee's Alice" before then its no problem cause most things will be explained at start.This game is definitely not for kids, not cause of these creepy creatures, more cause of the language in the real world and the story.Negative points for the mouse movements, you need a bit training for that.Negative points for many lag spikes with PhysX. Mostly if you have a AMD graphic card. After a while i figured out how to fix that.Much positive points for the awesome graphic, awesome locations. Really good puzzles and very cool monster. My favourite was the Doll Girl. XDThe Shrink function is really cool and somehow funny if you see Alice with her *Hicks*7/10

content:
Posted: March 31, 2012
												This one's a stinker stay away!!!!  As a game-- its totally unfun.  Combat, camera, targeting, looking for crap in every corner and smashing all the crates just for health and to advance plot/character/weapons-- all terrible.  It is well written, art stye is imaginative, story is good, acting is good (they should have made this a movie).  But every single gameplay element is annoying, boring or tedious.    Weirdness and "quirkiness" does not make it artistic (ooh look! another dimented doll!!!)  Alice left no emotional impact other than frustration, anger, annoyance, and boredom.  Do not play even for free.
